reviews: The best coffee full stop
Was expecting a flat white, got a luke warm cup of oat milk with what can only be described as a sad hint of espresso.

The latest addition to the Dineen family - this location is perfect in every way: the view, the customer service, the brilliant drinks and delicious food (special shout-out to the beef grilled cheese sandwich and pistachio muffin)

I've tried their coffee in the past, and wanted to see if they had a decent espresso. I can confidently say that it surpassed my expectations! Something so simple and basic, blew my mind with its flavour, and I'll certainly be making my way back in the new year for my morning jolt.
Great coffee.
I like there. It's a real Caribbean vibes.
Good coffee, efficient checkout line especially for the traffic of financial core.
Espresso wasn't the classic taste I'm use to and priced quite high
Nice spot. Lots of seating.
Fabulous coffee, first time at Dineen, enjoy every sip.
Coffee is great and better than Starbucks.  Staff is friendly as well.  I wished it opened a bit earlier but you can't have everything.
Nice friendly place with tasty cappuccino and pastry.
Top notch baristas here. Delicious espresso, cool vibe & architecture to boot!
Staff were amazing there they let me charge my phone because my phone was almost dead
It has the perfect "Suits" / financial district style.

I went there with a lot of expectations but the latte was very average.
It wasn’t a place that really impressed me and I don’t think I would go back there.

Yes, this branch is inside the lobby of the CIBC building (I was confused by Google map’s incorrect image). The lobby area is lovely and there is a beautiful waterfall outside to enjoy as you sip on a delish brew and cake :) really enjoyed the friendly service and lovely coffee !!
Free Wi-Fi, plenty of seating options. Indoors, so it's great on cooler days or rainy times.

Good place to sit down and have a coffee. Ideal to have a quick business meeting near the Union bus station. Clean and hygienic. Service was fast and hassle free. Slightly expensive but the location and ambience is premium, so worth it. Had a sandwich - Mediterranean veggie sandwich , basically veggies in a bagel ; cold sandwich. Was nice. Would have been tastier if it was served hot I think :)
Great location, exceptional service but the overall product is underwhelming for a near $8. London fog barely had a hint of bergamot - might have well just ordered steamed oat milk.
A lovely coffee shop!
Mediocre
Great and fast service! Had a Chai Latte for the first time here and really enjoyed it :)
Best iced vanilla lattes in Toronto! The rest of their menu is also fantastic.
nice place
Friendly staff, not too busy, good espresso and couldn't be more convenient in the financial district. Downtown Toronto prices, but not exceptionally high.
Best coffee ever!
My only complaint is how busy this location is, a great sign that they know what they are doing. My spectacular coffee was the other indicator.
Beautiful space and delicious coffee
Great location and setting. Good capuccino
One of the best coffee shops in the vicinity
Smoothest flat white I've ever had with super courteous and personable service! One of the best coffees I've had in a long while!
Great coffee! Great staff!

My go to morning espresso when I am in the financial district. This is espresso made with love and quality. There menu has a lot of amazing pastries, desserts and things to nibble on and complement my espresso. What I appreciate the most is the consistency in quality. Lots of coffee shops spin up and the quality winds down over time. Dineen raises the bar every time. This location has wifi and seats for those who want to work or even order some afternoon drinks (yes liquor is served here), I am more of a coffee guy though.
Great spot for a coffee or a beverage.

Super cute open area cafe in Commerce Court (under CIBC) in Financial District. Actually reminds me more of a bar than a coffee spot! Drinks are extremely standard, but would definitely come back for a date or a coffee chat.
Good but very busy
Delicious oat milk latte.

Good cappuccino. The drink was well made and tastes authentic.
The chocolate croissant was nothing special. I recommend passing on the baked goods as this is the third item I have tried at Dineen that tasted like packaged baked goods. Not bad by any means but not worth the price.

Disappointed but cognizant that it is the Financial district so items everywhere are always a little marked up.

Ambiance is lovely and the decor is definitely nice! Good place for meeting a client or friend!
Ok spot for catching up
Just a regular coffee shop
busy, vibrant with decent coffee.

Not as good as the original location, but good coffee and a nice location. It's often busy, but we were able to find a seat have have a good conversation, not too loud either. I would not pick this place for work, too much foot traffic during the week.
Love the coffee and love the treats. Location is awesome and the added seating on the side is great for impromptu meetings. Service is top notch!
Best coffee in town
Great coffee - really like the seating and open feel
Great additional Dineen location downtown and a go to place for coffee chats. I like the fact that they offer table service as well, which is a nice touch.
Good coffee and ambience
I don't care for the bankers crowd but I just love the setting! A bit pricy, but the coffee is excellent. Staff are pros.
Who would've thought that a coffee pop-up would become a hot spot for business meetings and coffee chats. The coffee is great and the place is surprisingly comfortable.
Great for an informal business chat in an interesting, sun filled atrium.
Amazing americanos!
Yuuuuuummmmy! A great cup of coffee and awesome atmosphere!
Amazing spot to talk and have a little drink or a coffee. They serve alcohol and serve tables. Amazing spot but sometimes lines are very long.

Dineen in the CIBC Commerce Court lobby is easily one of my favourite early morning coffee spots. To me, it feels like a small piece of Manhattan, before the morning rush begins. But unlike Manhattan, the barista's are always friendly and seldom even seem stressed out.
Best Cortado in the city!
Quick service...nice ambiance
Best coffe in town!
Great coffee and super friendly staff... Despite the massive crowds
Love the cappuccino.  The light roasted beans are great for home too.
The cafe offers an open dining option for street level commerce court for daytime business and functions.

This location has a great advantage of being inside the Commerce Court building with high ceilings, large lobby, glass all around yet a cozy setting area.
I like their menu selection and quality of products.
Great service! Generally i go with the americano!
Sometimes regular coffee just isn't hot enough. However decor is amazing and ambience wonderful
Great coffee , but the hot chocolate is not hit
Cortados to die for

Met my friend who was staying at the Adelaide Hotel here for drinks and to catch up. I was concerned it would be packed with the business crowd or not cool with us sitting and chatting, but the staff were awesome and very chill. The election of food isn't huge, and the drink menu is limited, but I felt right at home and would happily go back again.

Great coffee, pricing is fair.
Cool bar-style design.
Ideal for professionals to grab a coffee.
Line up quite long between 9-10am
Good coffee and lots of seating for such a small place.  But can be slow service as it is usually very busy.
Good coffee, impossibly slow service
Great service and a delicious variety of drinks!
Beautiful place but coffee isn’t extraordinary
Good coffee to start the day

It was alright. I kinda felt I was treated rudely by one of the barista I asked for the liquid sugar. They pointed me on the condiments bar where they thought it was located but I told them it wasn’t there and ended up walking on the other side to grab it. But its ok
